The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .o3AbszwKCj0KxwPr]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day Each: [[/item .W2FBHDlRi1EfvJdE]]{Darkness} , [[/item .wm9NnuX3UTMKNmJB]]{Faerie Fire}

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Needle Spray.name: Needle Spray
Needle Spray.description:
The dreshkan fires a spray of electrified needles.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Awaiting Needle.name: Awaiting Needle
Awaiting Needle.description:
Trigger: A creature the dreshkan can see attacks the dreshkan and the attack roll misses by 5 or more.

Response: The dreshkan makes a melee or ranged [[/item Needle]] attack against that creature.

Alchemical Implants.name: Alchemical Implants
Alchemical Implants.description: The dreshkan has Advantage on saving throws against &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] and the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] and &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] conditions. Magic that restores a creature’s Hit Points restores only half as many Hit Points to the dreshkan.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the dreshkan has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
Swarming Stance.description: The dreshkan can occupy the same space as another willing creature with this trait. While they share a creature’s space in this way, the dreshkan makes melee attack rolls with Advantage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dreshkan makes two melee attacks.

Mitflit.name: Mitflit
Mitflit.description: Mitflits, also known as mites, are self-loathing and pitiful cowards with oversized heads, blue skin, and a penchant for befriending the ugliest of vermin. They tame insects, spiders, and other small creatures to serve as faithful allies. Mitflits have lost most of their ancestral magic, leaving them to feel incomplete and full of doubt and insecurity. Mitflits find companionship in the other base creatures of the world, and forge strong bonds of friendship with vermin, the only other beings that seem willing to accept them. A social structure, even one in which they are bullied, partially fills the hole within most mitflits’ personalities, and they rarely rebel or lash out unless their rage hits a breaking point.

Hatred.name: Hatred
Hatred.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on attack rolls against dwarves and gnomes.

Keen Smell.name: Keen Smell
Keen Smell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed condition.

Speak with Arthropods.name: Speak with Arthropods
Speak with Arthropods.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can communicate simple concepts to arthropods when they speak in Undercommon.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .fCuWXUWpkEY5jBKy]]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day: [[/item .Ls3V1NCXaJuf2jHA]]{Bane}

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Charisma saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Vengeful.name: Vengeful
Vengeful.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see hits them with an attack.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a [[/item Dagger]] or [[/item Dart]] attack against the creature.

utility.condition: A creature the mitflit can see hits them with an attack.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Onl.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Onl.description: In humanoid form, Jaul makes three [[/item Dagger]] attacks. In hybrid form, he can attack like a humanoid or make one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11.

Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmWerewolf000000]{Werewolf} under the GM’s control and has 10 Hit Points.

Success: The target is immune to Jaul’s curse for 24 hours.

Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only).name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only).description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no {type} components and using {ability} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPoisonSpra]{Poison Spray} (2d12 Poison damage), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplProduceFla]{Produce Flame} (2d8 Fire damage)

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlamingSph]{Flaming Sphere}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpikeGrowt]{Spike Growth}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplConjureAni]{Conjure Animals}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRevivify00]{Revivify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSleetStorm]{Sleet Storm}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWaterBreat]{Water Breathing}

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: [[lookup @name]] shape-shifts into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or a Medium wolf, or he returns to his true humanoid form. His game statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Keen Hearing and Smell.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Keen Hearing and Smell.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Poison Spray.name: Poison Spray
Poison Spray.description:
You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 Poison damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d12 when you reach levels 5 (2d12), 11 (3d12), and 17 (4d12).

Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
Produce Flame.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, and it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to hurl fire at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Fire damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Flaming Sphere.name: Flaming Sphere
Flaming Sphere.description:
You create a 5-foot-diameter sphere of fire in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere makes a [[/save ability=dex dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw, taking 2d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet, rolling it along the ground. If you move the sphere into a creature’s space, that creature makes the save against the sphere, and the sphere stops moving for the turn.

When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. Flammable objects that aren’t being worn or carried start burning if touched by the sphere, and it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 2.

Spike Growth.name: Spike Growth
Spike Growth.description:
The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can’t see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a [[/check ability=wis skill=prc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

Conjure Animals.name: Conjure Animals
Conjure Animals.description:
You conjure nature spirits that appear as a Large pack of spectral, intangible animals in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The pack lasts for the duration, and you choose the spirits’ animal form, such as wolves, serpents, or birds.

You have Advantage on Strength saving throws while you’re within 5 feet of the pack, and when you move on your turn, you can also move the pack up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Whenever the pack moves within 10 feet of a creature you can see and whenever a creature you can see enters a space within 10 feet of the pack or ends its turn there, you can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d10 Slashing damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 3.

Revivify.name: Revivify
Revivify.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature revives with 1 Hit Point. This spell can’t revive a creature that has died of old age, nor does it restore any missing body parts.

materials.value: a diamond worth 300+ GP, which the spell consumes

Sleet Storm.name: Sleet Storm
Sleet Storm.description:
Until the spell ends, sleet falls in a 40-foot-tall, 20-foot-radius Cylinder centered on a point you choose within range. The area is &Reference[heavilyobscured], and exposed flames in the area are doused.

Ground in the Cylinder is &Reference[difficultterrain]. When a creature enters the Cylinder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[prone] condition and lose &Reference[concentration].

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

Bejeweled Necklace.name: Bejeweled Necklace
Bejeweled Necklace.description: A bejeweled necklace featuring a porpoise and an engraving which reads "Ayla, My Beloved".

Cauthooj.name: Cauthooj
Cauthooj.description: A lone cauthooj can be encountered in area I41.

Thoughtsense.name: Thoughtsense
Thoughtsense.description: The cauthooj can pinpoint the location of creatures with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher within 60 feet of them.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item .qLiOxBPkgnCEsLHh]] and makes two [[/item .KitgUNuKde8gJxxQ]] attacks.

Warbling Song.name: Warbling Song
Warbling Song.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gives a strange, ululating cry that causes nearby creatures to lash out violently and without control.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]], each [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Creatures immune to the Charmed condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions until the end of its next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a random creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

Success: The target is immune to Warbling Song for 1 minute.

Warbling Song.name: Warbling Song
Warbling Song.description:
The target can’t take Reactions until the end of its next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a random creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

Staccato Strike.name: Staccato Strike
Staccato Strike.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses subtle alterations in the pitch and tone of its song to direct one creature affected by its [[/item .qLiOxBPkgnCEsLHh]]. If that creature can hear the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it makes a melee attack against a creature within its reach chosen by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Hop-Dodge.name: Hop-Dodge
Hop-Dodge.description:
Trigger: A creature the cauthooj can see targets it with a melee attack.

Response: The cauthooj chooses another creature within 5 feet of them. That creature becomes the target of the triggering attack, and the cauthooj moves up to half their Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Urdefhan Cult Fanatic.name: Urdefhan Cult Fanatic
Urdefhan Cult Fanatic.description: Urdefhan cult fanatics serve more powerful figures in a cult, such as blood mages. They consider battle a sacred endeavor and usually fight to the death.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The urdefhan casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFeatherFal] (self only), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplResistance], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSacredFlam], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCommand000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInflictWou], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShieldofFa]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The urdefhan makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Dagger]] attack.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Daemonic Devotion.name: Daemonic Devotion
Daemonic Devotion.description: The urdefhan has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Resistance.name: Resistance
Resistance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a damage type: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Radiant, Slashing, or Thunder. When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by 1d4. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Acid Protection.name: Acid Protection
Acid Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Bludgeoning Protection.name: Bludgeoning Protection
Bludgeoning Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Cold Protection.name: Cold Protection
Cold Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Fire Protection.name: Fire Protection
Fire Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Lightning Protection.name: Lightning Protection
Lightning Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Necrotic Protection.name: Necrotic Protection
Necrotic Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Piercing Protection.name: Piercing Protection
Piercing Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Poison Protection.name: Poison Protection
Poison Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Radiant Protection.name: Radiant Protection
Radiant Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Slashing Protection.name: Slashing Protection
Slashing Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Thunder Protection.name: Thunder Protection
Thunder Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Shield of Faith.name: Shield of Faith
Shield of Faith.description: A shimmering field surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

Shimmering Field.name: Shimmering Field
Shimmering Field.description: The target gains a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11.

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by [[/damage 1d10 average]] Hit Points, and the urdefhan regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the urdefhan dies, their flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the urdefhan.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Urdefhan Brawler.name: Urdefhan Brawler
Urdefhan Brawler.description: All urdefhans are born to battle, but a rare few eschew manufactured weapons and fight only with their jaws and their fists. Those who survive become terrors of the battlefield and masters of unarmed combat.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The urdefhan casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFeatherFal] (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFear000000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. If the target already had the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition, it is instead &Reference[Stunned apply=false] for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition on a success.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If the urdefhan is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the urdefhan instead takes no damage if they succeed on the save, and only half damage if they fail. The urdefhan can’t use this trait if it has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the urdefhan dies, their flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the urdefhan.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The urdefhan makes three attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and two with their [[/item Unarmed Strike]].

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13.

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by [[/damage 3d6 average]] Hit Points, and the urdefhan regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Cult Tattooist.name: Cult Tattooist
Cult Tattooist.description: A cult tattooist is a ghoul in the Cult of the Canker who believes that marking scraps of dead flesh, with tattoos or otherwise, grants the flesh increased spiritual power. Most can’t help but consume the flesh they carefully mark, drawing the mystical energy into their own bodies, and must seek out new scraps of flesh upon which to practice their twisted art.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The ghoul makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or elf, it subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=pipXUAiH6XidkYGt]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
[[lookup @name]] devours a chunk of flesh from the corpse of a non-Construct creature that died within the past hour.

[[lookup @name]] regains [[/heal activity=eWjH9iJfZNIshmrR]] if the creature was Undead, or [[/heal activity=u9WKRpRoQwk1Ngpi]] Hit Points if it was any other creature. [[lookup @name]] can’t regain Hit Points from that corpse again.

Alternatively, [[lookup @name]] can consume a scrap of tattooed flesh. If they do, instead of regaining Hit Points, their Speed increases to 60 feet and they can use a Bonus Action to make a [[/item Claw]] attack. These benefits last until the end of the [[lookup @name]]'s next turn. [[lookup @name]] typically carries one scrap of tattooed skin.

Corpselight.name: Corpselight
Corpselight.description:
A will-o’-wisp that starves to death might rise as a cold, blue, glowing sphere of spongy wetness—a corpselight. A corpselight instinctively seeks out a host corpse to dwell within, as their physical form quickly deteriorates if not hidden within a dead creature.

A typical corpselight can animate only a Small or Medium corpse, but particularly powerful corpselights can inhabit larger bodies. Their basic abilities remain the same, but the damage they deal and the DC of their Death Light action increase as appropriate for their increased Challenge Rating.

Corpse Sense.name: Corpse Sense
Corpse Sense.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can magically pinpoint the location of corpses within 30 feet, even through solid barriers such as doors and thin walls. This sense is blocked by any solid barrier at least 5 feet thick.

Ephemeral.name: Ephemeral
Ephemeral.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t wear or carry anything.

Escape Corpse.name: Escape Corpse
Escape Corpse.description:
If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 Hit Points while they inhabit a corpse, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit.

On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead as the corpse collapses to the ground, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse.

Glow.name: Glow
Glow.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Dim Light in a 5-foot radius.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. The corpselight takes [[/damage average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description:
While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on d20 Tests and can’t use [[/item Claim Corpse]].

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect in the Effects tab to apply disadvantage on ability saves and skill checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls at this time.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the shroud has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Unstable Form.name: Unstable Form
Unstable Form.description: While outside a corpse, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take actions other than to use [[/item Claim Corpse]] or take the &Reference[Dash] action. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends their turn outside a corpse, they must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or lose [[/damage]] Hit Point.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: While they inhabit a corpse, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Claim Corpse.name: Claim Corpse
Claim Corpse.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] merges with the corpse of a Small or Medium Humanoid within 5 feet of them and causes the corpse to stand up, provided the corpse hasn’t been inhabited by a [[lookup @name lowercase]] in the past 24 hours. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[/heal average]].

While they inhabit a corpse, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] loses their [[/item Ephemeral]], [[/item Glow]], and [[/item Incorporeal Movement]] traits and gains the [[/item Multiattack]] and [[/item Death Light]] actions; otherwise, they use the statistics of a Zombie without the Undead Fortitude trait.

Death Light.name: Death Light
Death Light.description:
While they inhabit a corpse, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] emits a sickly blue beam of light from their mouth and eyes.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Es62fSCflAaxlRlL]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Es62fSCflAaxlRlL]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=Es62fSCflAaxlRlL]]. Constructs and Undead automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. If at least one creature in the beam fails its saving throw, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[/heal average]], gaining any Hit Points that exceed their Hit Point maximum as Temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Spellvoid Wisp.name: Spellvoid Wisp
Spellvoid Wisp.description: Spellvoid wisps feed not on fear but on the ephemeral potentiality of magic, twisting it into a bizarre form of sustenance. They are more likely than other wisps to be intellectual or scholarly, and most know about—and revere—the malevolent patron of wisps, Nhimbaloth. They usually leave non-spellcasters alone and sometimes follow groups without spellcasters in the hope of being led to more appetizing creatures.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: [[lookup @name]] and their light has the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition until the its &Reference[Concentration] ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after [[lookup @name]] makes an attack roll or uses [[/item Consume Magic]] or [[/item Spellcasting]].

Consume Magic.name: Consume Magic
Consume Magic.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=VeKzxr5l6rQGAucC]], one creature that is maintaining &Reference[Concentration] on a spell within [[lookup @range.value activity=VeKzxr5l6rQGAucC]] feet of [[lookup @name]].

Failure: The target’s Concentration ends, and [[lookup @name]] regains [[/heal average]].

Failure or Success: The creature is immune to [[lookup @name]]'s Consume Magic for 1 hour.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two [[/item Shock]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .tOyZpushe86qUivs]]{Guidance}, [[/item .MVo3FDrkOvy7PNNK]]{Light}, [[/item .HRAnP3G9ZUjOJ4Wv]]{Sacred Flame}, [[/item .NqehAVpaxheurkG8]]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day Each: [[/item .otHSYmVPWWd2ThXH]]{Augury}, [[/item .r0JB1XRiWfZlNTOS]]{Bane}, [[/item .dhjUiuHvcx4vIJtp]]{Blindness/Deafness}, [[/item .AXYRslMrglJwTyos]]{Darkness}, [[/item .vBF81Ywl4lJswS08]]{Guiding Bolt}, [[/item .Ak71cxtkPPt9AE6g]]{Sanctuary}, [[/item .HRLrUV6xaR6xpmhE]]{Spiritual Weapon}

1/Day Each: [[/item .1BqTZcet2uJ6uq67]]{Dispel Magic}, [[/item .af1I7Qm4ka7Z86k9]]{Fear}, [[/item .5ZJw0ImXPuRrO5PY]]{Spirit Guardians}

Variable Illumination.name: Variable Illumination
Variable Illumination.description:
[[lookup @name]] sheds Bright Light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. [[lookup @name]] can alter the radius as an action.

Foundry Note

The prototype token's light is set at 5-feet bright light and 10-feet dim light by default.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.description:
You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses the omen from the Omens table.

OmenFor Results That Will Be …
WealGood
WoeBad
Weal and woeGood and bad
IndifferenceNeither good nor bad

The spell doesn't account for circumstances, such as other spells, that might change the results.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: specially marked sticks, bones, cards, or other divinatory tokens worth 25+ GP

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Booming Voice.name: Booming Voice
Booming Voice.description: Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Charisma saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

Warded.name: Warded
Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Any other creature's Speed is halved in the Emanation, and whenever the Emanation enters a creature's space and whenever a creature enters the Emanation or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 Radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 Necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

Half Speed.name: Half Speed
Half Speed.description: The creature's speed is halved while within the Emanation.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Nox.name: Nox
Nox.description: Nox prefers to speak through their music rather than their voice. One of the grim and silent calignis who ventured up into the Abomination Vault’s middle levels from below, Nox earned a place in Shadow Malice by demonstrating superlative skill with a theorbo. Nox dislikes the brutality of combat and seeks opportunities to end a fight quickly, usually by making unexpected attacks with their crossbow or knife.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Nox casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShatter000]

Nimble Escape.name: Nimble Escape
Nimble Escape.description: Nox takes the Disengage or Hide action.

Unnerving Riff.name: Unnerving Riff
Unnerving Riff.description:
Trigger: A creature that can hear Nox and that Nox can see makes a D20 Test while Nox is holding a musical instrument. Creatures immune to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition are immune to this effect.

Response: Nox rolls a [[/r d6]] and subtracts the result from the triggering roll.

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
Nox explodes in a burst of fire when he dies.

Saving Throw: DC 10, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from Nox.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything Nox is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Nox deals an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) damage when he hits a target with an attack and has Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Nox that doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and Nox doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

damage.condition: Hits a target with an attack where has advantage or its within 5 feet of an ally of his

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Nox has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
A loud noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered there makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has Disadvantage on the save.

A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Gogiteth.name: Gogiteth
Gogiteth.description:
A gogiteth is a slavering nightmare of teeth, eyes, and hairy spiderlike legs, and its appearance is invariably seared into the minds of any who witness it. Hives of these skittering monsters haunt the lowest reaches of the Darklands, competing with cave worms and other subterranean horrors for food and resources. A gogiteth is rarely alone, as they learned that the best means of survival is sticking with others of their own kind. Even the hardiest Darklands residents seek cover when a gogiteth is spotted, for where there’s one, a swarm is sure to follow.

Gogiteths make a clacking sound as they skitter. The joints in their many legs pop and crack with each movement, though they can suppress this voluntarily and hunt silently without alerting prey. They can also make a high-pitched whistling sound that echoes throughout the caverns where they live. Some Darklands natives report that groups of gogiteths sometimes join together in eerie, discordant songs.

Carry Off Prey.name: Carry Off Prey
Carry Off Prey.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

Relentless Hunter.name: Relentless Hunter
Relentless Hunter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and two with their [[/item Leg]]{Legs}.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 18).

Until this grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and takes [[/damage average activity=iY1h16QeaXfft56r]] damage at the start of each of its turns, and the gogiteth can’t Bite another target.

damage.condition: If the target is grappled and restrained by the attacking creature

affects.special: Grappled and restrained by the attacking creature

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition. Until this grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false]

Skittering Assault.name: Skittering Assault
Skittering Assault.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up twice their Speed.

During this movement, each time the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves within 10 feet of a creature, they can make a [[/item Leg]] attack against that creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t attack the same creature more than once in this way.

Skittering Reposition.name: Skittering Reposition
Skittering Reposition.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see moves into a space within [[lookup @range.value activity=PTub0WYV343y3wnE]] feet of them.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half their Speed without provoking &Reference[Opportunity Attacks].

utility.condition: A creature the gogiteth can see moves into a space within 10 feet of them

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Quara casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDancingLig]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]

Skirmisher.name: Skirmisher
Skirmisher.description: Quara takes the &Reference[Dash] or &Reference[Disengage] action. If she moves at least 5 feet, the next attack she makes before the end of her current turn deals an extra 24 ([[/r 7d6]]) damage.

Commanding Aura.name: Commanding Aura
Commanding Aura.description: Quara’s drow allies that can see or hear her gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and ability checks while within 30 feet of her.

Commanding Aura.name: Commanding Aura
Commanding Aura.description: Drow allies that can see or hear her gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and ability checks while within 30 feet of her.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: Quara has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition. Magic can’t put her to sleep.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Quara has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Quara makes three [[/item Dagger]] or [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]] attacks.

Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
Repeating Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] this way, attacks against the creature have Advantage. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. While poisoned this way, attacks against the creature have Advantage. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the Unconscious condition while Poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Poisoned and Unconscious.name: Poisoned and Unconscious
Poisoned and Unconscious.description: The target has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. While poisoned this way, attacks against the creature have Advantage. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the Unconscious condition while Poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Grothlut.name: Grothlut
Grothlut.description:
Sluglike abominations, grothluts are fleshwarps that were once humans. While their head and torso are vaguely human, their arms are rubbery and move awkwardly at their sides. Wretched creatures, they moan piteously when other creatures are near, pleading with their last remnants of human consciousness.

Many fleshwarpers consider the grothlut to be a failure of a creation, as the transformation all but stamps out the human consciousness. Others disagree, arguing that warping the creature’s mind makes it all the more useful, since its stupidity makes it pliable and easy to herd. Some fleshwarpers use grothluts as guardians to slowly patrol the edges of their enclaves. Others use them as crude shock troops, unleashed to soften enemy forces before more-valuable warriors wade in and cut down those who have been nauseated by the grothluts’ exploded organs and flesh.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Piteous Moan]] and makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks or two [[/item Spit]] attacks.

Spit.name: Spit
Spit.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Miss: [[/damage average activity=2AGn36Ynsfgipuki]] damage

Piteous Moan.name: Piteous Moan
Piteous Moan.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=M1Qvk3gi271M02JI]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=M1Qvk3gi271M02JI]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Creatures immune to the Charmed condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Piteous Moan of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute.

Disadv. Attack Rolls.name: Disadv. Attack Rolls
Disadv. Attack Rolls.description: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Disgusting Demise.name: Disgusting Demise
Disgusting Demise.description:
When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, its digestive organs rupture, unleashing alchemical acid and poison.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=VFMaZjiyBlhenBCW]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=VFMaZjiyBlhenBCW]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] .

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Morlock Scavenger.name: Morlock Scavenger
Morlock Scavenger.description: Most morlocks have little talent for crafting, but a rare few have an uncanny knack for tinkering.

Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
Swarming Stance.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy the same space as another willing creature with this trait.

While they share a creature’s space in this way, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes melee attack rolls with Advantage.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Scuttling Attack.name: Scuttling Attack
Scuttling Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half their Speed without provoking &Reference[Opportunity Attacks]. During this movement, &Reference[Difficult Terrain] doesn’t cost the [[lookup @name lowercase]] extra movement. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then makes a melee attack.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Urevian.name: Urevian
Urevian.description:
Urevian is a phistophilus, or contract devil. These bureaucrats of Hell are rarely found outside the infernal courts, and then almost always to pursue potential contracts, tempting mortals to sell their souls in exchange for achieving their worldly desires. While other contract devils pride themselves on airtight clauses, hidden meanings, and steep penalties to gain the upper hand, Urevian prefers to smile his way into a straightforward deal that’s beneficial to everyone. He’s as kind and generous as he can afford to be toward an opposing party, making them feel like they’re holding all the cards. In a world of snarling fiends and vicious hell-spawn, Urevian seeks to stand out by simply using manners. Devils have a bad reputation for taking advantage of their marks; playing against that is one of Urevian’s strengths, and he uses it to great advantage.

Urevian wants the soul of Carman Rajani. With Belcorra’s return, he can finally escape his agreement with her, but he needs a Rajani soul to do so. Only one such soul remains: the blacksmith and scoundrel who is Vol’s sole remaining descendant. Ideally, Urevian convinces the party to fetch it for him. The contract devil is true to his word, and he departs quickly once he has his prize. The characters might refuse—and, perhaps, should refuse—despite Urevian’s honeyed words. If they fight and defeat him, he isn’t destroyed. Instead, his soul is cast into the court of the powerful entity to whom he pledged the Rajani soul, where he must hastily explain his failure to avoid obliteration.

Urevian spends his time in the room he’s claimed as his personal domain (area G10).

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Ward Contract.name: Ward Contract
Ward Contract.description:
Any signed contract [[lookup @name]] carries (including one draped over his horns) has Immunity to all damage, except damage dealt by [[lookup @name]].

Magic can’t compel [[lookup @name]] to destroy, nullify, or alter a warded contract.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .C5GPEqvpV4W3KvBe]]{Detect Magic}, [[/item .8iSXYHTi2fUjMP1I]]{Detect Thoughts}, [[/item .DSwVzwaVpormT5P4]]{Scrying} (only to target a creature with which he has a contract, who makes the saving throw with Disadvantage; to a specific creature named in a contract he has; or to a descendant of any of those creatures), [[/item .J9jze9pSuqNUPsnX]]{Tongues}

2/Day: [[/item .Luw4dXHj8dqJSZhF]]{Sending}

1/Day Each: [[/item .vUvfpq9oFjW5LDtx]]{Enthrall}, [[/item .fOcmFou3l6niPW2O]]{Fireball}, [[/item .Oaq2Rx7b8XzvxDQA]]{Locate Creature} (unlimited range when targeting creatures who returned to life a soul he trapped through a contract), [[/item .n3ccN2aWICU5Q8P8]]{Private Sanctum}, [[/item .BSZooOwaVMu2cNss]]{Silence}, [[/item .CLqyVjNSrN1umbem]]{Wall of Force}

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw.
