On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Sending.name: Sending
Sending.description:
You send a short message of 25 words or fewer to a creature you have met or a creature described to you by someone who has met it. The target hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables targets to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive. You know if the delivery fails.

Upon receiving your message, a creature can block your ability to reach it again with this spell for 8 hours. If you try to send another message during that time, you learn that you are blocked, and the spell fails.

Locate Creature.name: Locate Creature
Locate Creature.description:
Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature's location if that creature is within 1,000 feet of you. If the creature is moving, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific creature known to you or the nearest creature of a specific kind (such as a human or a unicorn) if you have seen such a creature up close—within 30 feet—at least once. If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFleshtoSto]{Flesh to Stone} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph} spell, this spell doesn't locate the creature.

This spell can't locate a creature if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the creature.

Silence.name: Silence
Silence.description: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the Sphere has Immunity to Thunder damage, and creatures have the &Reference[deafened apply=false] condition while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

Silenced.name: Silenced
Silenced.description: Any creature or object entirely inside the Sphere has Immunity to Thunder damage, and creatures have the Deafened condition while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

Wall of Force.name: Wall of Force
Wall of Force.description:
An Invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a globe with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick and lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisintegra]{Disintegrate} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane and blocks ethereal travel through the wall.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Distracted.name: Distracted
Distracted.description: The target has a −10 penalty to [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Private Sanctum.name: Private Sanctum
Private Sanctum.description:
You make an area within range magically secure. The area is a Cube that can be as small as 5 feet to as large as 100 feet on each side. The spell lasts for the duration.

When you cast the spell, you decide what sort of security the spell provides, choosing any of the following properties:

  • Sound can't pass through the barrier at the edge of the warded area.
  • The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including &Reference[Darkvision]) through it.
  • Sensors created by Divination spells can't appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
  • Creatures in the area can't be targeted by Divination spells.
  • Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
  • Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

Casting this spell on the same spot every day for 365 days makes the spell last until dispelled.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can increase the size of the Cube by 100 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes three attacks: two with his [[/item Horns]] and one with his [[/item Quill]].

Quill.name: Quill
Quill.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=HUUfqnfg92sSmmvo]].

Failure: The target has an infernal wound. While the target has a wound, it loses [[/damage average activity=c6gluCPcDt0lh1Qh]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. Each time [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10).

Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful [[/check average]]. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

Foundry Note

Scaling is implemented on the Damage Activity to configure the infernal wound damage each time this attack hits the target. Each scaling value corresponds to the number of hits taken.

save.condition: If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct

Damage: Infernal Wound.name: Damage: Infernal Wound
Damage: Infernal Wound.condition: While the target has a infernal wound

Drawn to Service.name: Drawn to Service
Drawn to Service.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that would compel them to serve a master outside Abaddon.

The cost of Material components and payment required for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlanarAlly]{Planar Ally}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlanarBind]{Planar Binding}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGate000000]{Gate}, and similar spells are reduced by half if the only target is a ceustodaemon.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claws]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average activity=AnCp17pFNp5iYYdW]] damage.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average activity=oDNjoxBkBCT4D1N9]] damage.

Grappled and Restrained.name: Grappled and Restrained
Grappled and Restrained.description:
f the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Escape Tests (see source item for DC)

[[/check skill=ath ability=str]]

[[/check skill=acr ability=dex]]

Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
Flame Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot cone.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] damage, and the target catches fire. While on fire, the target takes [[/damage average activity=H1RiXv4iVx1DOdGL]] damage at the end of each of its turns. Any can use an action to extinguish the flames.

Success: Half damage only.

Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
Flame Breath.description: While on fire, the target takes [[/r 1d10]] Fire damage at the end of each of its turns. Any can use an action to extinguish the flames.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .TuiQ7KXJzCKUKQRh]]{Detect Evil and Good} (Celestials and Fiends only), [[/item .zUiiGLAHU4mULGsK]]{See Invisibility}

2/Day Each: [[/item .NmZQoIs0Wg1snRjT]]{Dimension Door} , [[/item .YMDbeXiBuCebrTRR]]{Dispel Magic}

1/Day Each: [[/item .Dfi5hMOkqAWdSo2w]]{Fly} , [[/item .loyGHeQLKAqdsMkx]]{Hold Person}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport to a location within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "300 feet upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle."

You can also teleport one willing creature. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you teleport, and it teleports to a space within 5 feet of your destination space.

If you, the other creature, or both would arrive in a space occupied by a creature or completely filled by one or more objects, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 Force damage, and the teleportation fails.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Scalathrax.name: Scalathrax
Scalathrax.description:
These slippery, scaly horrors dwell in remote cave networks in the Darklands, preferring to nest in narrow fissures. When on the hunt, they flick barbs from their long legs, or spray down their foes with a clear, toxic oil. The same oil coats the scalathrax’s body, all of which is quite flammable—whether it’s coating a victim or the scalathrax itself.

While a scalathrax appears feral, they are more intelligent than they seem and are capable of speaking Undercommon in a wet, slithery voice. The vast majority of scalathraxes are foul-tempered and quick to anger, and most of them enjoy killing. It’s possible to forge an alliance with a scalathrax, but doing so requires either constant bribes of new creatures to kill or a particularly intimidating personality—scalathraxes respect bullies, seeing in them a mirror of their own cruel values.

Oily Scales.name: Oily Scales
Oily Scales.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on Dexterity checks made to escape from the Grappled condition or squeeze through a narrow space.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Fire damage, this trait doesn’t function for 1 minute.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two melee attacks against the same target. Alternatively, they make two ranged attacks, each against a different target.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=utLn4OTBWPAcPlfD]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way, the target’s Speed is reduced by 10 feet. As the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the Poisoned condition on itself on a success.

save.condition: When hit by the bite attack

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description:
The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way, the target’s Speed is reduced by 10 feet.

As the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the Poisoned condition on itself on a success.

Toxic Oil Spray.name: Toxic Oil Spray
Toxic Oil Spray.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=DsFXtyge7SNzExXE]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=DsFXtyge7SNzExXE]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=DsFXtyge7SNzExXE]].

Failure: The target takes [[/damage average]] damage and is covered in oil.

While covered in oil, the target has Vulnerability to Fire damage. In addition, whenever the target makes an attack with a weapon and rolls a 5 or lower on the attack roll, it drops the weapon.

The oil lasts for 1 minute, until a creature uses an action to wipe it off, or until the target takes Fire damage.

Success: Half damage only.

Toxic Oil Spray.name: Toxic Oil Spray
Toxic Oil Spray.description: The target is is covered in oil. While covered in oil, the target has Vulnerability to Fire damage.

Quill Kick.name: Quill Kick
Quill Kick.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see enters a space within 5 feet of it.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a melee [[/item Quills]] attack against the creature.

utility.condition: A creature the scalathrax can see enters a space within 5 feet of it.

Seugathi Reality Warper.name: Seugathi Reality Warper
Seugathi Reality Warper.description: Seugathi reality warpers create and destroy inhospitable environments by bending reality. A neothelid might spawn such a seugathi to create habitats for unique slaves or guests, or to destroy the ecosystem of a troublesome species. Darklands scholars refer to reality warpers as veterans among seugathis, but they’re more accurately compared to aggressive landscape architects.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The seugathi casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .217SGCPQLjA5LF2b]]{Detect Magic}, [[/item .blEUAaP89l0XjqSu]]{Eldritch Blast} (two beams), [[/item .cZtLznhLDCdUMclj]]{Mage Hand}

2/Day Each: [[/item .9qffieBEZFsFw1Tc]]{Confusion}, [[/item .xKwINyd3BSwYSgc7]]{Detect Thoughts}

1/Day Each: [[/item .dKstKmwXCJuyk54c]]{Black Tentacles}, [[/item .B9XjAKFjBqJDwxwl]]{Fly}, [[/item .KusD1hRQg97h03Bd]]{Major Image}, [[/item .8y5ft6XIe3RVTk1t]]{Suggestion}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The seugathi uses [[/item Mind Fog]], then makes three attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and two with their [[/item Scimitar]].

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RCBN5kS7ADkSvUDp]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned in this way, the target also makes Wisdom saving throws with Disadvantage.

Success: Half damage only.

Poisoned/Disadv. WIS Saves.name: Poisoned/Disadv. WIS Saves
Poisoned/Disadv. WIS Saves.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned in this way, the target also makes Wisdom saving throws with Disadvantage.

Mind Fog.name: Mind Fog
Mind Fog.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=KsfLtBmdzPngt0dk]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=KsfLtBmdzPngt0dk]]-foot Emanation originating from the seugathi. Creatures immune to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions until the end of their next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The seugathi commands the target to move up to its Speed and make a melee attack against a creature of the seugathi’s choice.

Success: The target is immune to Mind Fog for 1 minute

Mind Fog.name: Mind Fog
Mind Fog.description:
The target can’t take Reactions until the end of their next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The seugathi commands the target to move up to its Speed and make a melee attack against a creature of the seugathi’s choice.

Warp Reality.name: Warp Reality
Warp Reality.description:
The seugathi magically bends reality in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Ey4pQ9QihgVkg0gQ]]-foot Emanation originating from themself or in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=6I7A8jfK4Vkj1MjK]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=6I7A8jfK4Vkj1MjK]]-foot-wide [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=6I7A8jfK4Vkj1MjK]]. The area becomes normal terrain or &Reference[Difficult Terrain], as the seugathi chooses.

A creature in the area is subjected to the following effect.

Charisma Saving Throw: [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mnnNOeEdYsUIPmNr]]

Failure: The target takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Use Magic Device.name: Use Magic Device
Use Magic Device.description: The seugathi ignores all class, species, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

2 {Total Beams}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or that target can't take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Sphere's radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Confused.name: Confused
Confused.description:
The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Black Tentacles.name: Black Tentacles
Black Tentacles.description:
Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in that area into &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

Each creature in that area makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d6 Bludgeoning damage, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A creature also makes that save if it enters the area or ends it turn there. A creature makes that save only once per turn.

A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the condition on itself on a success.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A &Reference[Restrained apply=false] creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the condition on itself on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Staff of the Woodlands.name: Staff of the Woodlands
Staff of the Woodlands.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Druid)

This staff has 6 charges and can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you have a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls.

Spells. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

Spell

Charge Cost

Animal Friendship

1

Awaken

5

Barkskin

2

Locate Animals or Plants

2

Pass without Trace

2

Speak with Animals

1

Speak with Plants

3

Wall of Thorns

6

Tree Form. You can take a Magic action to plant one end of the staff in earth in an unoccupied space and expend 1 charge to transform the staff into a healthy tree. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius. The tree appears ordinary but radiates a faint aura of Transmutation magic that can be discerned with the Detect Magic spell. While touching the tree and using a Magic action, you return the staff to its normal form. Any creature in the tree falls when the tree reverts to a staff.

Regaining Charges. The staff regains 1d6 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the staff loses its properties and becomes a nonmagical Quarterstaff.

Awaken.name: Awaken
Awaken.description:
You spend the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, and then touch the target. The target must be either a Beast or Plant creature with an Intelligence of 3 or less or a natural plant that isn't a creature. The target gains an Intelligence of 10 and the ability to speak one language you know. If the target is a natural plant, it becomes a Plant creature and gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it gains senses similar to a human's. The DM chooses statistics appropriate for the awakened Plant, such as the statistics for the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.gaSTr7DFZJLmgI2J]{Awakened Shrub} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.UR2gWLFHmFwG7ReH]{Awakened Tree} in the Monster Manual.

The awakened target has the &Reference[Charmed] condition for 30 days or until you or your allies deal damage to it. When that condition ends, the awakened creature chooses its attitude toward you.

materials.value: an agate worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

Animal Friendship.name: Animal Friendship
Animal Friendship.description:
Target a Beast that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Beast for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Barkskin.name: Barkskin
Barkskin.description: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin assumes a bark-like appearance, and the target has an Armor Class of 17 if its AC is lower than that.

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Locate Animals or Plants.name: Locate Animals or Plants
Locate Animals or Plants.description: Describe or name a specific kind of Beast, Plant creature, or nonmagical plant. You learn the direction and distance to the closest creature or plant of that kind within 5 miles, if any are present.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action's skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don't pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Speak with Plants.name: Speak with Plants
Speak with Plants.description:
You imbue plants in an immobile 30-foot Emanation with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question plants about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

You can also turn &Reference[difficultterrain] caused by plant growth (such as thickets and undergrowth) into ordinary terrain that lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where plants are present into Difficult Terrain that lasts for the duration.

The spell doesn't enable plants to uproot themselves and move about, but they can move their branches, tendrils, and stalks for you.

If a Plant creature is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language.

Wall of Thorns.name: Wall of Thorns
Wall of Thorns.description:
You create a wall of tangled brush bristling with needle-sharp thorns. The wall appears within range on a solid surface and lasts for the duration. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 7d8 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature can move through the wall, albeit slowly and painfully. For every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. Furthermore, the first time a creature enters a space in the wall on a turn or ends its turn there, the creature makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 7d8 Slashing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Both types of damage increase by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 6.

Traversal Save.name: Traversal Save
Traversal Save.condition: first time a creature enters or ends its turn in the wall

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Khurfel makes three attacks: one with his Bite, one with his Dagger, and one with his Wounding Rhoka Sword.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Hit Points, and Khurfel regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 100/400 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Emerald Fulcrum Lens.name: Emerald Fulcrum Lens
Emerald Fulcrum Lens.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This concave green lens is pitted and flawed. Its edges are jagged and cut those who don’t handle the lens with care. While you are attuned to the Emerald Fulcrum Lens, your flesh is waxen and pallid, and spells and magical abilities that restore a creature’s Hit Points have no effect on you. (For example, the Cure Wounds spell doesn’t cause you to regain Hit Points, although you can regain Hit Points when you rest normally.) In return, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have Resistance to Necrotic damage.

  • Whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain Hit Points, you regain an additional 4 Hit Points.

  • If damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, you can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken), unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

Grim Resistance. You can use a Magic action to grasp the lens tightly with one hand and draw out Nhimbaloth’s magic. You regain 8d4 + 8 Hit Points, and you have Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects until the end of your next turn. Once you have used this property of the lens, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Infuse Nhimbaloth’s Tenacity. As a Magic action, you can present the lens in your hand and make a melee attack with a +7 attack bonus against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, you force the splinter of Nhimbaloth’s essence from the lens to possess the target. You lose Attunement to the lens, and the target becomes attuned to the lens instead, except the target can’t use the lens’s Grim Resistance or Infuse Nhimbaloth’s Tenacity properties. The target can’t end Attunement to the lens, but it can be ended by any effect that removes a possession effect, such as the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} spell. Since this is a form of possession, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbEvilAndGoodPr]{Protection from Evil and Good} spell protects the target and causes Nhimbaloth’s essence to remain in the lens. The lens doesn’t have any magical properties until the possession ends; when it does, the essence returns to the lens.

save.condition: Damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points

Grim Saves.name: Grim Saves
Grim Saves.description: You have Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When Khurfel dies, his flesh sublimates into a noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from Khurfel.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Wounding Rhoka Sword.name: Wounding Rhoka Sword
Wounding Rhoka Sword.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Hit Points lost to this weapon’s damage can be regained only through a Short or Long Rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means. Once per turn, Khurfel can wound a creature he hits with this weapon. A creature can suffer from multiple wounds from the weapon at once. While wounded, the creature takes [[/damage 1d4 average necrotic]] damage at the start of each of its turns for each wound it has.

At the end of each of its turns, the target makes a [[/save 15 con]] saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature or a creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a [[/skill 15 med]] check, ending the effect of all wounds on a success.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
Khurfel casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFeatherFal]{Feather Fall} (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAugury0000]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBlindnessD]{Blindness/Deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDivination]{Divination}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHarm000000]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.description:
You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses the omen from the Omens table.

OmenFor Results That Will Be …
WealGood
WoeBad
Weal and woeGood and bad
IndifferenceNeither good nor bad

The spell doesn't account for circumstances, such as other spells, that might change the results.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: specially marked sticks, bones, cards, or other divinatory tokens worth 25+ GP

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Divination.name: Divination
Divination.description:
This spell puts you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask one question about a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which might be a short phrase or cryptic rhyme. The spell doesn't account for circumstances that might change the answer, such as the casting of other spells.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: incense worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes

Harm.name: Harm
Harm.description: You unleash virulent magic on a creature you can see within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 14d6 Necrotic damage, and its Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage it took. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. This spell can't reduce a target's Hit Point maximum below 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Vengeful Strike.name: Vengeful Strike
Vengeful Strike.description:
Trigger: A creature Khurfel can see within 5 feet hits him with an attack while he is holding a melee weapon.

Response: Khurfel makes a melee attack against the creature.

Urdefhan Blood Mage.name: Urdefhan Blood Mage
Urdefhan Blood Mage.description: Hardened masters of occult power, urdefhan blood mages trade their blood for magical might. A heavily scarred blood mage is held in esteem by their fellow urdefhans, as it shows they have survived many bargains with eerie occult patrons.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The urdefhan casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEldritchBl], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLevitate00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMessage000]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplComprehend], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHellishReb], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMistyStep0], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShatter000]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBlight0000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFear000000]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The urdefhan makes two attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and one with their [[/item Dagger]].

Blood Offering.name: Blood Offering
Blood Offering.description: The urdefhan loses [[/damage 1d10 average]] Hit Points. The range of the next spell they cast before the end of their turn increases by 30 feet.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the urdefhan dies, their flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the urdefhan.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

[[(floor((@details.level+1)/6)+1)]]{Total Beams}

Levitate.name: Levitate
Levitate.description:
One creature or loose object of your choice that you can see within range rises vertically up to 20 feet and remains suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate an object that weighs up to 500 pounds. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the target's altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction on your turn. If you are the target, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can take a Magic action to move the target, which must remain within the spell's range.

When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft.

Levitating.name: Levitating
Levitating.description: The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Message.name: Message
Message.description:
You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

Comprehend Languages.name: Comprehend Languages
Comprehend Languages.description: For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any language that you hear or see signed. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text. This spell doesn't decode symbols or secret messages.

materials.value: a pinch of soot and salt

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description:
The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

activation.condition: taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
A loud noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered there makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has Disadvantage on the save.

A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Blight.name: Blight
Blight.description:
A creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Plant creature automatically fails the save.

Alternatively, target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub. It doesn't make a save; it simply withers and dies.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13.

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by [[/damage 3d6 average]] Hit Points, and the urdefhan regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Caligni Defender.name: Caligni Defender
Caligni Defender.description: Caligni defenders protect caligni enclaves and travelers.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The caligni makes one [[/item Shortsword]] attack and one [[/item Dagger]] attack. Alternatively, they make two [[/item Shortbow]] attacks.

Protective Shove.name: Protective Shove
Protective Shove.description:
Trigger: A willing ally within 5 feet of the caligni is hit by a melee attack roll.

Response: The caligni adds 3 to the AC of their ally, possibly causing the triggering attack to miss. The caligni can then move their ally up to 5 feet or give them the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
The caligni combusts in white-hot flames when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=raxPS7WJTDJDVkLG]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=raxPS7WJTDJDVkLG]]-foot Emanation originating from the caligni.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything the caligni is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The caligni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .PAVoVKgWRyxaHx6e]]{Darkness} , [[/item .4FAUuh7K71wcRRrA]]{Detect Magic} , [[/item .Qjw1STQar554fs1C]]{Fog Cloud}

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The caligni deals an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the caligni that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the caligni doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, the caligni has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that automatically grants disadvantage to ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply advantage to attack rolls at this time. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Drow Hunter.name: Drow Hunter
Drow Hunter.description: Hunters seek out game to keep drow communities fed and functioning.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow attacks once with their [[/item Longsword]] and once with their [[/item Dagger]]. Alternatively, they attack twice with their [[/item Longbow]].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .jrOu6HYwVWNbUNVL]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day Each: [[/item .UPanvyguDfao3htt]]{Darkness} , [[/item .YcdTqGeMeqadZ2vq]]{Faerie Fire}

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Nimble Escape.name: Nimble Escape
Nimble Escape.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Disengage] or &Reference[Hide] action.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: Otari can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: Otari can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. He takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

Site-Bound.name: Site-Bound
Site-Bound.description: Otari can’t leave area D18. He can’t be destroyed permanently until the four icons are placed on the altar in area D13.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: Otari enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. He is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but he can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Otari deals an extra 17 (5d6) damage when he hits a target with an attack and has Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Otari that doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and Otari doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

damage.condition: Hits a target and has Advantage on the attack roll

Infest Shadow.name: Infest Shadow
Infest Shadow.description:
Otari teleports into the shadow of a creature he can see within 30 feet of him and makes a [[/item Withering Touch]] attack against a creature within 5 feet of that creature (but not the creature whose shadow he infests). On a hit, attacks against the target have Disadvantage until the start of Otari’s next turn. Otari then teleports back to his starting point.

The creature whose shadow Otari infests contracts Filth Fever, the disease that killed Otari. The creature has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Whenever the Poisoned creature finishes a Long Rest, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15.

Failure: The creature’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) and doesn’t return to normal until the Poisoned condition ends.

Success: The Poisoned condition ends.

Froghemoth.name: Froghemoth
Froghemoth.description: A terrifying abomination of teeth, tentacles, and unbridled rage, the froghemoth is capable of devouring dinosaurs and even dragons. It is a frighteningly effective ambush hunter, immersing itself in the mire with only its eyestalk protruding and watching in every direction at once with uncanny precision.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks: one with its [[/item Bite]] and two with its [[/item Tentacle]]{Tentacles}.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it subject to the following effect.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=pjEfZZbGPU8yL6IQ]].

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] swallows the target. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can swallow one Large creature or two Medium or smaller creatures at a time. A swallowed creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and takes [[/damage average activity=1vurfcvVOl5CQwtI]] damage at the start of each its turns.

If the froghemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=7uDlXZHiJIFHCH5B]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth with the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

If the froghemoth dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Save: 30+ Damage.name: Save: 30+ Damage
Save: 30+ Damage.condition: If the froghemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature

Escape Corpse.name: Escape Corpse
Escape Corpse.condition: Must use 10 feet of movement to escape

Swallowed.name: Swallowed
Swallowed.description: A swallowed creature is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the nightgarm.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: A swallowed creature escaping the stomach of the nightgarm lands &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}.

Aquatic Ambush.name: Aquatic Ambush
Aquatic Ambush.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is underwater and hidden from a creature within 20 feet of it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] Swims up to 20 feet and makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against that creature.

The froghemoth has Advantage on the attack roll.

Lashing Tongue.name: Lashing Tongue
Lashing Tongue.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=zAzxXnxHP6ypxFfE]] feet of it misses the froghemoth with an attack.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] lashes out its tongue at the attacker.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=zAzxXnxHP6ypxFfE]].

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls the creature to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it and makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against it.

save.condition: A creature the froghemoth can see within 15 feet of it misses the froghemoth with an attack.

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 19) from one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s four tentacles.

Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and takes [[/damage average activity=3p0S11O0UwI013IR]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

damage.condition: If restrained and grappled by the froghemoth

affects.special: Restrained and grappled by the froghemoth

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description:
If the target is a creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition by the froghemoth.

Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Electric Torpor.name: Electric Torpor
Electric Torpor.description:
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it takes no damage but is slowed until the end of its next turn.

While slowed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take Reactions and can’t use [[/item Multiattack]], and its Speed is halved.

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.condition: Whenever the froghemoth is subjected to Lightning damage

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.description: Whenever the froghemoth is subjected to Lightning damage, can’t take Reactions and can’t use Multiattack, and its Speed is halved.

Otherworldly Vision.name: Otherworldly Vision
Otherworldly Vision.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s stalked eyes allow it to see in all directions at once. It has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

It can see Invisible creatures and objects, as well as into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 30 feet.

It automatically sees through visual illusions within 30 feet of it.

Prodigious Leap.name: Prodigious Leap
Prodigious Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Long Jump is up to 20 feet, and its High Jump is up to 10 feet with or without a running start.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The urdefhan casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFeatherFal] (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The urdefhan makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Shauth Lash]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Save Saving Throw: DC 12.

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) Hit Points, and the urdefhan regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the urdefhan dies, their flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the urdefhan.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Shauth Lash.name: Shauth Lash
Shauth Lash.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the urdefhan scores a Critical Hit, the target takes an extra 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) Slashing damage. This damage isn’t doubled.

This long metal chain bears hook-like barbs made of alchemically strengthened urdefhan teeth. If you score a Critical Hit against a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead while using this weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 Slashing damage. This extra damage isn’t doubled. Urdefhans can train to drink blood through hollow parts of a shauth lash for a moment after hitting, and urdefhans hold these weapons with the same reverence with which they do shauth blades.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description: If the urdefhan has hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead with a Shauth Lash attack this turn, the urdefhan drinks the creature’s blood from the blade. The urdefhan regains [[/heal average]]{5 (1d10)} Hit Points.

Ogre Spider.name: Ogre Spider
Ogre Spider.description: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants. The placement of their eyes above their wide mandibles evokes the grimacing visage of an ogre’s leer.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=rmNMIm40kfrygr5n]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way.

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=PNCh158bJqcf6cIr]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=PNCh158bJqcf6cIr]] feet.
