The servant can perform simple tasks that a human could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring drinks. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.

If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

materials.value: a bit of string and of wood

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hulk makes two [[/item Claws]] attacks.

Shanrigol Behemoth.name: Shanrigol Behemoth
Shanrigol Behemoth.description:
Shanrigols that grow with the additions of many living victims can become truly enormous in size and pose a greater danger in their expanding hunting territory. Subterranean communities will collapse tunnels to stop a shanrigol behemoth from reaching their settlements.

Many shanrigol behemoths absorb enough brain matter to form crude intelligences and take a serpentine or humanoid shape. They’re more varied in their abilities than shanrigol heaps, as they often gain abilities from their constituent creatures. The shanrigol behemoth presented below contains flesh from driders and urdefhans, giving it a web attack and necrotic decay ability. Not all shanrigol behemoths have these two abilities, but should have other abilities to replace them.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 18).

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the shanrigol can see within 60 feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10, HP 15; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage).

Hungry Slap.name: Hungry Slap
Hungry Slap.description:
Trigger: A creature within 10 feet of the shanrigol hits or misses it with an attack.

Response: The shanrigol makes a [[/item Slam]] attack against the creature.

Aberrant Unlife.name: Aberrant Unlife
Aberrant Unlife.description: The shanrigol is treated as both an Aberration and Undead creature for effects that rely on creature type.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the shanrigol dies, its flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the shanrigol.

Failure: 28 (8d6) Necrotic damage.

Success: Half damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The shanrigol makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks or two [[/item Bone Shard]] attacks. In place of one attack, it can use Sapping Squeeze or Web.

Sapping Squeeze.name: Sapping Squeeze
Sapping Squeeze.description:
One creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the shanrigol takes [[/damage average]] damage and is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18.

Failure: The creature takes [[/damage average activity=RPJ34us9ytncodBv]] damage, and the shanrigol regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Undulating Step.name: Undulating Step
Undulating Step.description: The shanrigol moves up to its Speed. During this movement, the shanrigol &Reference[Difficult Terrain] doesn’t cost the shanrigol extra movement, and the shanrigol can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without expending extra movement to do so.

Mitflit Boss.name: Mitflit Boss
Mitflit Boss.description:
Boss Skrawng (LE male mitflit gang boss) is the leader of the Mudlicker mitflit gremlins.

A mitflit with the ingenuity to both bully others and cajole loyalty rises to the boss of a mitflit gang.

Hatred.name: Hatred
Hatred.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on attack rolls against dwarves and gnomes.

Keen Smell.name: Keen Smell
Keen Smell.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: [[lookup @name]] has Disadvantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed condition.

Speak with Arthropods.name: Speak with Arthropods
Speak with Arthropods.description: [[lookup @name]] can communicate simple concepts to arthropods when they speak in Undercommon.

Vengeful.name: Vengeful
Vengeful.description:
Trigger: A creature [[lookup @name]] can see hits them with an attack.

Response: [[lookup @name]] makes a [[/item Short Trident]] attack against the creature.

utility.condition: A creature Boss Skrawng can see hits them with an attack.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Tearing Rend.name: Tearing Rend
Tearing Rend.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits the same creature with two or more [[/item Claw]]{claws} on the same turn, they deal that creature an additional [[/damage average]] damage.

affects.special: that the derghodaemon has hit witch two or more claws on the same turn

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes four [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Swarming Infestation.name: Swarming Infestation
Swarming Infestation.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the derghodaemon can see within 60 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] Piercing damage immediately and [[/damage average activity=YaFHjeNW7oHMja30]] Piercing damage at the end of the target's next turn.

Success: Half initial damage only.

affects.special: that failed their saving throw against Swarming Infestation

Swarming Infestation.name: Swarming Infestation
Swarming Infestation.description: Creatures that fail their saving throw against Swarming Infestation take an additional [[/r 6d6]] Piercing damage at the end of their next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .rkyyzyONBBgtL7Ng]]{Detect Evil and Good} (Celestial and Fiends only), [[/item .fvY6nlz84Mwc1M2n]]{Insect Plague}, [[/item .jkduOVAd8Tgebleg]]{See Invisibility}

2/Day Each: [[/item .peJ7dct0mbLdLW0I]]{Dimension Door}, [[/item .euRVBDHp7K5ucbs8]]{Dispel Magic}

1/Day Each: [[/item .g0n7wl9mOKZnkR61]]{Confusion}

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport to a location within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "300 feet upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle."

You can also teleport one willing creature. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you teleport, and it teleports to a space within 5 feet of your destination space.

If you, the other creature, or both would arrive in a space occupied by a creature or completely filled by one or more objects, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 Force damage, and the teleportation fails.

Insect Plague.name: Insect Plague
Insect Plague.description:
Swarming locusts fill a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The Sphere remains for the duration, and its area is &Reference[LightlyObscured] and &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or that target can't take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Sphere's radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Confused.name: Confused
Confused.description:
The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the hand to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the hand clings to its throat. While clinging to the target, the hand moves with the target, and the target can’t speak. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the hand as an action.

Mark Quarry.name: Mark Quarry
Mark Quarry.description:
The hand can choose a quarry by touching a creature’s blood. If the hand lacks a quarry, it can mark any creature it hits with a [[/item Claw]] attack as its quarry.

The creature remains the hand’s quarry until it dies or until the hand gains a new quarry.

The hand has Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track its quarry, and it deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage when it hits its quarry with its [[/item Claw]] attack.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The caligni casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFogCloud00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidance00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplResistance], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSparetheDy]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAid0000000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBanishment], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateFood], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCreateorDe], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCureWounds], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDeathWard0], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectEvil], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlameStrik], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHeroesFeas], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInsectPlag]

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
The caligni explodes into brilliant motes of magical energy when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the caligni.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything the caligni is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The caligni deals an extra 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the caligni that doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and the caligni doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

Resistance.name: Resistance
Resistance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a damage type: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Radiant, Slashing, or Thunder. When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by 1d4. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Acid Protection.name: Acid Protection
Acid Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Bludgeoning Protection.name: Bludgeoning Protection
Bludgeoning Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Cold Protection.name: Cold Protection
Cold Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Fire Protection.name: Fire Protection
Fire Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Lightning Protection.name: Lightning Protection
Lightning Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Necrotic Protection.name: Necrotic Protection
Necrotic Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Piercing Protection.name: Piercing Protection
Piercing Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Poison Protection.name: Poison Protection
Poison Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Radiant Protection.name: Radiant Protection
Radiant Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Slashing Protection.name: Slashing Protection
Slashing Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Thunder Protection.name: Thunder Protection
Thunder Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Spare the Dying.name: Spare the Dying
Spare the Dying.description:
Choose a creature within range that has 0 Hit Points and isn't dead. The creature becomes Stable.

Cantrip Upgrade. The range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

Aid.name: Aid
Aid.description:
Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's Hit Point maximum and current Hit Points increase by 5 for the duration.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Each target's Hit Points increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 2.

Level 2: +5 Max HP.name: Level 2: +5 Max HP
Level 2: +5 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 3: +10 Max HP.name: Level 3: +10 Max HP
Level 3: +10 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 4: +15 Max HP.name: Level 4: +15 Max HP
Level 4: +15 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 5: +20 Max HP.name: Level 5: +20 Max HP
Level 5: +20 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 6: +25 Max HP.name: Level 6: +25 Max HP
Level 6: +25 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 7: +30 Max HP.name: Level 7: +30 Max HP
Level 7: +30 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 8: +35 Max HP.name: Level 8: +35 Max HP
Level 8: +35 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 9: +40 Max HP.name: Level 9: +40 Max HP
Level 9: +40 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Banishment.name: Banishment
Banishment.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn't return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM's choice) associated with its creature type.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Banished.name: Banished
Banished.description:
While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn’t return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM’s choice) associated with its creature type.

Create Food and Water.name: Create Food and Water
Create Food and Water.description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of fresh water on the ground or in containers within range—both useful in fending off the hazards of malnutrition and dehydration. The food is bland but nourishing and looks like a food of your choice, and the water is clean. The food spoils after 24 hours if uneaten.

Create or Destroy Water.name: Create or Destroy Water
Create or Destroy Water.description:
You do one of the following:

Create Water. You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot Cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames there.

Destroy Water. You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot Cube within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the Cube increases by 5 feet, for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a mix of water and sand

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Death Ward.name: Death Ward
Death Ward.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Protection from Death.name: Protection from Death
Protection from Death.description:
The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Heroes' Feast.name: Heroes' Feast
Heroes' Feast.description:
You conjure a feast that appears on a surface in an unoccupied 10-foot Cube next to you. The feast takes 1 hour to consume and disappears at the end of that time, and the beneficial effects don't set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes gains several benefits, which last for 24 hours. The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

materials.value: a gem-encrusted bowl worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

Consume Feast.name: Consume Feast
Consume Feast.chatFlavor: Hit Point maximum increased by healing amount

Feast's Benefits.name: Feast's Benefits
Feast's Benefits.description: The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Insect Plague.name: Insect Plague
Insect Plague.description:
Swarming locusts fill a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The Sphere remains for the duration, and its area is &Reference[LightlyObscured] and &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the caligni has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Wand of Lightning Bolts.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
Wand of Lightning Bolts.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 3 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Feast's Benefits.name: Feast's Benefits
Feast's Benefits.description: The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: While they inhabit a corpse, the corpselight makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Death Light.name: Death Light
Death Light.description:
While they inhabit a corpse, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] emits a sickly blue beam of light from their mouth and eyes.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Es62fSCflAaxlRlL]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=Es62fSCflAaxlRlL]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=Es62fSCflAaxlRlL]]. Constructs and Undead automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. If at least one creature in the beam fails its saving throw, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[/heal average]], gaining any Hit Points that exceed their Hit Point maximum as Temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes 2 attacks.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 12).

Sapping Squeeze.name: Sapping Squeeze
Sapping Squeeze.description:
One creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the shanrigol takes 7 (2d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage and is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12.

Failure: The creature takes 4 (1d8) Necrotic damage, and the shanrigol regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Undulating Step.name: Undulating Step
Undulating Step.description: The shanrigol moves up to its Speed. During this movement, the shanrigol &Reference[Difficult Terrain] doesn’t cost the shanrigol extra movement, and the shanrigol can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without expending extra movement to do so.

Drow Shootist.name: Drow Shootist
Drow Shootist.description: Drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect for their skill and swagger.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .gNq2FqZR833L6SSb]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day Each: [[/item .N8tAWRPJlYTihGL4]]{Darkness} , [[/item .JoCy1MX8fvBqV0y2]]{Faerie Fire}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow attacks twice with their [[/item Elven Curve Blade]] or twice with their [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]].

Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
Repeating Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains Poisoned. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains &Reference[Poisoned apply=false].

Shootist’s Bandolier.name: Shootist’s Bandolier
Shootist’s Bandolier.description: The drow reloads their repeating hand crossbow.

Indomitable.name: Indomitable
Indomitable.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Saves +5.name: Saves +5
Saves +5.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The drow deals an extra 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the drow doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Reload Trick.name: Reload Trick
Reload Trick.description: If the drow’s [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]] is empty, they reload it and make one attack with it. If the target hasn’t seen the drow use Reload Trick before, the drow makes the attack with Advantage.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Caligni Priest.name: Caligni Priest
Caligni Priest.description: Priests aid caligni custodians in managing a congregation of caligni worshipers. They rarely have true divine power, instead leveraging occult abilities.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The caligni casts one of the following spells, using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .LKemCcQiDoQ0aCFK]]{Chill Touch} , [[/item .a0zCfttyFumNTyk3]]{Darkness} , [[/item .niFxvqwcZ9uoc8k0]]{Detect Magic} , [[/item .0732TwDiyzQjhcmZ]]{Fog Cloud}

2/Day Each: [[/item .laj0pCFqIBSQnPAc]]{Shield}

1/Day Each: [[/item .EkCT03ZfNCyNuIr4]]{Blindness/Deafness} , [[/item .sdr1RYcNHO4IqJOa]]{Enthrall} , [[/item .hBmWX6UTr73DYzBC]]{Hold Person} , [[/item .gOjBNu9Bpsx2OTvl]]{Invisibility} , [[/item .WyocrD5rfWDZgtNk]]{Suggestion}

Occult Ward.name: Occult Ward
Occult Ward.description:
Trigger: The caligni fails a saving throw against a spell.

Response: The caligni draws a simple icon in the air and adds 3 to the result of their save, possibly causing the save to succeed.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The caligni makes two [[/item Dagger]] attacks.

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Distracted.name: Distracted
Distracted.description: The target has a −10 penalty to [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

Blocked Healing.name: Blocked Healing
Blocked Healing.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The drow deals an extra 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the drow doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
The caligni explodes in a burst of chilling shadow when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=yekDKOgvxkYJYpGu]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=yekDKOgvxkYJYpGu]]-foot Emanation originating from the caligni.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything the caligni is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

Potion of Clairvoyance.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
Potion of Clairvoyance.description:
An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

Augrael.name: Augrael
Augrael.description:
A creature of two worlds welcomed by neither, Augrael is a morlock ghoul exiled by his living kin among the Ghost Queen morlocks on the second level, yet not accepted by the Cult of the Canker ghouls. While he appears monstrous, he’s rational and even cordial.

Augrael can usually be found in area C1 on the third level of the Abomination Vaults. The characters might convince Augrael to accompany them as they explore that level.

Scuttling Stride.name: Scuttling Stride
Scuttling Stride.description: &Reference[Difficult Terrain] caused by rubble or uneven ground doesn’t cost [[lookup @name lowercase]] extra movement.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) that imposes disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or elf, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=P4gKtRSn3oWKg3Uf]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
[[lookup @name]] devours a chunk of flesh from the corpse of a non-Construct creature that died within the past hour.

He regains [[/heal activity=fKocJXJI5EuhAQ9s]] if the creature was Undead, or [[/heal activity=8ONuH5a90TohpxH7]] if it was any other creature. [[lookup @name]] can’t regain Hit Points from that corpse again.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The chuul makes two [[/item Pincer]] attacks and uses [[/item Paralyzing Tentacles]].

Pincer.name: Pincer
Pincer.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from one of two pincers.

Mind Feeding.name: Mind Feeding
Mind Feeding.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, one creature with the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition within 5 feet of the chuul.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the chuul’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Paralyzing Tentacles.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
Paralyzing Tentacles.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the chuul.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: Difficult Terrain caused by swampy terrain doesn’t cost the chuul extra movement.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The chuul can breathe air and water.

Sense Magic.name: Sense Magic
Sense Magic.description: The chuul senses magic within 120 feet of themself. This trait otherwise works like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic} spell but isn’t itself magical.

Urdefhan Death Scout.name: Urdefhan Death Scout
Urdefhan Death Scout.description: Other urdefhans scorn the death scouts’ stealthy methods, but none can argue with their results.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The urdefhan casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFeatherFal] (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12.

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by [[/damage 1d10 average]] Hit Points, and the urdefhan regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description: If the urdefhan has hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead with a Shauth Blade attack this turn, the urdefhan drinks the creature’s blood from the blade. The urdefhan regains 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) Hit Points.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the urdefhan dies, their flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the urdefhan.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The urdefhan makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Shauth Blade]] attack.

Gulzash.name: Gulzash
Gulzash.description: A lizardfolk born and raised in the Darklands, Gulzash found a taste for music early in life. He created his own battle lute and traveled until he met and joined Shadow Malice. The others enjoy his eager violence, but dislike his strong personal odor. He swings his battle lute in combat with reckless glee.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Mosh.name: Mosh
Mosh.description: Gulzash moves up to half his Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and pushes a creature he can see within 5 feet of him. That creature must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: Gulzash can hold his breath for 15 minutes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Gulzash makes two melee attacks, each with a different weapon.

Seugathi Servant.name: Seugathi Servant
Seugathi Servant.description: The most common seugathis spawned by neothelids are seugathi servants. Their masters equip them with tools useful in their tasks (often a wand and a weapon), and they rarely value other material things beyond their usefulness in their imprinted mission.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way, the target also makes Wisdom saving throws with Disadvantage.

save.condition: When the target is a creature

Mind Fog.name: Mind Fog
Mind Fog.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the seugathi. Creatures immune to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions until the end of their next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The seugathi commands the target to move up to its Speed and make a melee attack against a creature of the seugathi’s choice.

Success: The target is immune to Mind Fog for 1 minute

Use Magic Device.name: Use Magic Device
Use Magic Device.description: The seugathi ignores all class, species, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The seugathi uses [[/item Mind Fog]], then makes two attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and one with their [[/item Shortsword]].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The seugathi casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEldritchBl]{Eldritch Blast} (two beams), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl two beams of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Child of Belcorra uses [[/item .r3ABIOFDCQlZtleL]] and makes one [[/item .ThwFDP8vT0PV3uo1]] attack.

Rotting Fist.name: Rotting Fist
Rotting Fist.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed.

While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse.

A creature dies and decays into a foul-smelling sludge if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Breathtaking Glare.name: Breathtaking Glare
Breathtaking Glare.description:
The Child of Belcorra targets one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] they can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] feet of them. If the target can see the Child, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]].

Failure: The target can’t breathe or speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Success: The target is immune to this Child of Belcorra’s Breathtaking Glare for the next 24 hours.

9q2zHwpczCAKxjUK.name: Breathtaking Glare
9q2zHwpczCAKxjUK.description: The creature can’t breathe or speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description:
&Reference[Difficult Terrain] caused by swampy terrain doesn’t cost the Child of Belcorra extra movement.

The Child of Belcorra has a +2 bonus to Stealth checks made in swamps.

Gnomish Cunning.name: Gnomish Cunning
Gnomish Cunning.description: The Child of Belcorra has Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

Ambusher.name: Ambusher
Ambusher.description: In the first round of a combat, the Child of Belcorra has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that began the combat surprised.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The devil deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the devil that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the devil doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes 2 [[/item .xE2PhqQfQm2Q8sOA]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=s9zXpRBr8f6WJ50h]].

Failure: The target contracts a magical contagion called Cocytan Filth. The contagion has no effect for [[/r 1d4]] days. After that time, the creature’s Strength score is reduced by [[/r 1d4]], to a minimum score of 2. Each time the creature finishes a Long Rest thereafter, it repeats the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature’s Strength score is reduced by an additional [[/r 1d4]]. On a success, its Strength score is restored by [[/r 1d4]]. When the creature’s Strength score returns to normal, the contagion is cured.

Infernal Eye.name: Infernal Eye
Infernal Eye.description: The devil touches one willing creature and magically replays up to 10 minutes of events the devil has witnessed, which the creature receives in a flash of information. After relaying these visions, the accuser devil can’t recall those events again.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The devil has the Invisible condition until the devil’s Concentration ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the devil makes an attack roll.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The devil has the Invisible condition until the devil’s Concentration ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the devil makes an attack roll.

Soulbound Doll.name: Soulbound Doll
Soulbound Doll.description:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal’s soul. Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort and possess a variety of different powers (such as the birdlike soulbound doll presented below, which can fly and attack with their beak).

The doll’s soul fragment resides in a focus gem typically embedded in their neck or chest. The soulbound doll’s focus gem often retains the doll’s memories even after the doll’s destruction. The intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable about soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .YccCbYuqbrcHjFDJ]]{Light}, [[/item .FEGliHf93hjfP7K7]]{Mage Hand}, [[/item .ROUsRVlahnVvUDYh]]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day: [[/item .awvHx0vDrxsNoWfF]]{Vampiric Touch}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Vampiric Touch.name: Vampiric Touch
Vampiric Touch.description:
The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 Necrotic damage, and you regain Hit Points equal to half the amount of Necrotic damage dealt.

Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as a Magic action, targeting the same creature or a different one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two [[/item Beak]] attacks.

Chafkhem.name: Chafkhem
Chafkhem.description: Chafkhem is trapped in area E17, on the fifth level of the Abomination Vaults.

Staff of Swarming Insects.name: Staff of Swarming Insects
Staff of Swarming Insects.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard)

This staff has 10 charges.

Insect Cloud. While holding the staff, you can take a Magic action and expend 1 charge to cause a swarm of harmless flying insects to fill a 30-foot Emanation originating from you. The insects remain for 10 minutes, making the area &Reference[Heavily Obscured] for creatures other than you. A strong wind (like that created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses the swarm and ends the effect.

Spells. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack modifier. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

Spell

Charge Cost

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGiantInsec]{Giant Insect}

4

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInsectPlag]{Insect Plague}

5

Regaining Charges. The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, a swarm of insects consumes and destroys the staff, then disperses.

FVTT Note: In accordance with Chafkhem's stat block, this weapon has been modified to deal 1d8 bludgeoning, and 3d6 additional necrotic damage. However, this is not an inherent property of this weapon, and only reflects its damage when wielded by Chafkhem himself. If a PC takes and wields this item, ensure that you remove the additional damage accordingly.

Giant Insect.name: Giant Insect
Giant Insect.description:
You summon a giant centipede, spider, or wasp (chosen when you cast the spell). It manifests in an unoccupied space you can see within range and uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbmobGiantInsec]{Giant Insect} stat block. The form you choose determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 Hit Points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your Initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the &Reference[Dodge] action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

In addition to the noted usage of the spell's level in the insect's Traits and Actions, the following attributes are also affected.

Giant Insect
AC11 + the spell's level
HP30 + 10 for each spell level above 4
Speed40 ft., Climb 40 ft., Fly 40 ft. (Wasp only)
PBequals your Proficiency Bonus

Insect Plague.name: Insect Plague
Insect Plague.description:
Swarming locusts fill a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The Sphere remains for the duration, and its area is &Reference[LightlyObscured] and &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: Chafkhem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: If reduced to 0 Hit Points, Chafkhem gains a new body in 24 hours, regaining all his Hit Points and becoming active again. The new body appears inside his magic circle. This trait doesn’t function if Chafkhem’s magic circle is the target of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Chafkhem uses [[/item .SscaMSiGAKicMHdL]] and makes one [[/item .XgRVNTPAyQdUT7uv]] or [[/item .4IeS39F46V6kAORa]] attack. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .6MEghn5Y2UB6iYZJ]] .

Rotting Fist.name: Rotting Fist
Rotting Fist.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Dreadful Glare.name: Dreadful Glare
Dreadful Glare.description:
Chafkhem targets one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] he can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] feet of him. If the target can see Chafkhem, it is subjected to the following effect.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]]

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of Chafkhem's next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false condition for the same duration.

Success: The target is immune to Chafkhem's Dreadful Glare for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Chafkhem casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplChillTouch], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTrueStrike]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBlight0000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHaste00000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterInv], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTashasHide], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbProtectionFro], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSeeInvisib], Sage’s Curse, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplUnseenServ]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimateObj], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGlobeofInv]

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

Blocked Healing.name: Blocked Healing
Blocked Healing.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Dimensional Escape.name: Dimensional Escape
Dimensional Escape.description: Chafkhem teleports up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Due to the magical protections on area E17, he can’t teleport through that room’s walls or door, but he can teleport within the room and isn’t restricted outside of it.
